## Logspot {#logspot-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

Logspot is a lightweight, free and open source template for your
changelog made with Vue, Nuxt and Tailwindcss.

How it works?

1.  Each `.md`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
    data-version="v1"} file in `/content/posts/`{.inline_code__cgX1y
    geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} counts as one changelog
    post, logspot uses the [nuxt content
    module](https://content.nuxtjs.org/){.link_link__hbWKh
    .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

#### Features {#features .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

1.  Markdown support
2.  Icons support using Iconify
3.  Code syntax highlighting using Shiki.js
4.  Frontmatter - dates, author supported
5.  Vue components inside markdown using Nuxt contents MDC format - More
    on this
    [here](https://content.nuxtjs.org/guide/writing/mdc){.link_link__hbWKh
    .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
6.  Icons support -
    `:icon{name="ph:user-circle-duotone"}`{.inline_code__cgX1y
    geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} will show a user icon - find
    more icons at
    [https://icones.js.org](https://icones.js.org){.link_link__hbWKh
    .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
7.  Alert component with icon, title and description.

Format

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
::alert
---
icon: fluent:error-circle-24-regular
title: This is alert with default variant colors.
description: This will pick up colors from your primary color set in the tailwind config file. You can use this to show some kind of message to your users.
---
::
```

This above content will render a alert component, something like this

1.  Widget page, Logspot also has a page specifically meant for widgets,
    here\'s an
    [example](https://logspot.vercel.app/test){.link_link__hbWKh
    .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

[https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15716057/215352102-7796a751-a18f-499b-8302-700092b739f1.mp4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15716057/215352102-7796a751-a18f-499b-8302-700092b739f1.mp4){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

### Setup Locally {#setup-locally .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

Make sure to install the dependencies:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
# yarn
yarn install

# npm
npm install

# pnpm
pnpm install --shamefully-hoist
```

### Development Server {#development-server .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

Start the development server on
[http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
npm run dev
```

### Production {#production .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

Build the application for production:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
npm run build
```

Locally preview production build:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
npm run preview
```

Checkout the [deployment
documentation](https://v3.nuxtjs.org/guide/deploy/presets){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} for
more information.
:::

## A statically generated blog example using Next.js and Contentful {#a-statically-generated-blog-example-using-next.js-and-contentful .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

This example showcases Next.js\'s [Static
Generation](https://nextjs.org/docs/basic-features/pages){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
feature using
[Contentful](https://www.contentful.com/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} as
the data source.

### Demo {#demo .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

#### [https://app-router-contentful.vercel.app/](https://app-router-contentful.vercel.app/){.link_link__hbWKh .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} {#httpsapp-router-contentful.vercel.app .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

### Deploy your own {#deploy-your-own .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

Using the Deploy Button below, you\'ll deploy the Next.js project as
well as connect it to your Contentful space using the Vercel Contentful
Integration.

[](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fvercel%2Fnext.js%2Ftree%2Fcanary%2Fexamples%2Fcms-contentful&project-name=nextjs-contentful-blog&repository-name=nextjs-contentful-blog&demo-title=Next.js+Blog&demo-description=Static+blog+with+multiple+authors+using+Draft+Mode&demo-url=https%3A%2F%2Fnext-blog-contentful.vercel.app%2F&demo-image=https%3A%2F%2Fassets.vercel.com%2Fimage%2Fupload%2Fv1625705016%2Ffront%2Fexamples%2FCleanShot_2021-07-07_at_19.43.15_2x.png&integration-ids=oac_aZtAZpDfT1lX3zrnWy7KT9VA&env=CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_SECRET&envDescription=Any%20URL%20friendly%20value%20to%20secure%20Draft%20Mode){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

### How to use {#how-to-use .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

Execute [`create-next-app`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/packages/create-next-app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} with
[npm](https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/init){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"},
[Yarn](https://yarnpkg.com/lang/en/docs/cli/create/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}, or
[pnpm](https://pnpm.io){.link_link__hbWKh .link_highlight__kJZF9
rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} to bootstrap the example:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
npx create-next-app --example cms-contentful cms-contentful-app
```

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
yarn create next-app --example cms-contentful cms-contentful-app
```

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm create next-app --example cms-contentful cms-contentful-app
```

### Configuration {#configuration .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

#### Step 1. Create an account and a space on Contentful {#step-1.-create-an-account-and-a-space-on-contentful .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

First, [create an account on
Contentful](https://www.contentful.com/sign-up/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

After creating an account, create a new empty **space** from the
[dashboard](https://app.contentful.com/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} and
assign to it any name of your liking.

#### Step 2. Create a content model {#step-2.-create-a-content-model .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

The [content
model](https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/concepts/data-model/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
defines the data structures of your application/websites. The structures
are flexible and you can tailor them to your needs.

For this example you need to create a content model that defines an
author and a post content type. **You can create these two by running a
script or by doing it manually** to familiarize yourself with the
Contentful user interface.

Run a script to create the content model

This project includes a setup script which you can use to set up the
content model expected by the source code.

In your Contentful dashboard go to **Settings \> General Settings** and
copy the **Space ID**.

Next, go to **Settings \> CMA tokens** and create a new token by
clicking **Create personal access token**. This token has the same
access rights as the logged in user. **Do not share it publicly**, you
will only use it to set up your space and can delete it afterwards.

With the space ID and management access token at hand run the following
command:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
npx cross-env CONTENTFUL_SPACE_ID=YOUR_SPACE_ID CONTENTFUL_MANAGEMENT_TOKEN=XXX npm run setup
```

This command will create the needed content structures and set up your
Contentful space ready to use. The output should look as follows:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
> cms-contentful@1.0.0 setup /Users/stefan.judis/Projects/next.js/examples/cms-contentful
> node ./contentful/setup.js $CONTENTFUL_SPACE_ID $CONTENTFUL_MANAGEMENT_TOKEN

   ...

```

Create the content model manually Create an `Author`{.inline_code__cgX1y
geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} content type

From your contentful space, go to **Content model** and add a new
content type:

- Give it the **Name** `Author`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"}, the **Api Identifier** should be
  `author`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}

Once the content model is saved, add these fields (you don\'t have to
modify the settings unless specified):

- `name`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} -
  **Text** field (type **short text**). **Field ID** should be set to
  `name`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
- `picture`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} - **Media** field (type **one file**). **Field ID**
  should be set to `picture`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"}

Save the content type and continue.

Create a `post`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} type

From your contentful space, go to **Content model** and add another
content type:

- Give it the **Name** `Post`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"}, the **Api Identifier** should be
  `post`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}

Next, add these fields (you don\'t have to modify the settings unless
specified):

- `title`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} -
  **Text** field (type **short text**)
- `content`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} - **Rich text** field
- `excerpt`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} - **Text** field (type **Long text, full-text
  search**)
- `coverImage`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} - **Media** field (type **one file**)
- `date`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} -
  **Date and time** field
- `slug`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} -
  **Text** field. You can optionally go to the settings of this field,
  and under **Appearance**, select **Slug** to display it as a slug of
  the `title`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} field.
- `author`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} -
  **Reference** field (type **one reference**)

Save the content type and continue.

#### Step 3. Validate your content model {#step-3.-validate-your-content-model .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

After setting up the content model (either manually or by running
`npm run setup`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} or `yarn setup`{.inline_code__cgX1y
geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}), it should look as follows.

**Content model overview**

#### Step 4. Populate Content {#step-4.-populate-content .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Go to the **Content** section in your space, then click on **Add entry**
and select the **Author** content type:

- You just need **1 author entry**.
- Use dummy data for the text.
- For the image, you can download one from
  [Unsplash](https://unsplash.com/){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

Next, create another entry with the content type **Post**:

- We recommend creating at least **2 post entries**.
- Use dummy data for the text.
- For images, you can download them from
  [Unsplash](https://unsplash.com/){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.
- Pick the **author** you created earlier.

**Important:** For each entry and asset, you need to click on
**Publish**. If not, the entry will be in draft state.

#### Step 5. Set up environment variables {#step-5.-set-up-environment-variables .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

From your contentful space, go to **Settings \> API keys**. There will
be an example Content delivery / preview token - you can use these API
keys. (You may also create a new key.)

Next, copy the `.env.local.example`{.inline_code__cgX1y
geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} file in this directory to
`.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
(which will be ignored by Git):

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
cp .env.local.example .env.local
```

Then set each variable on `.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y
geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}:

- `CONTENTFUL_SPACE_ID`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} should be the **Space ID** field of your API Key
- `CONTENTFUL_ACCESS_TOKEN`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} should be the **[Content Delivery
  API](https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/references/content-delivery-api/){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} -
  access token** field of your API key
- `CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_ACCESS_TOKEN`{.inline_code__cgX1y
  geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} should be the **[Content
  Preview
  API](https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/references/content-preview-api/){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} -
  access token** field of your API key
- `CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_SECRET`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} should be any value you want. It must be URL
  friendly as the dashboard will send it as a query parameter to enable
  Next.js Draft Mode
- - `CONTENTFUL_REVALIDATE_SECRET`{.inline_code__cgX1y
    geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} should be any value you
    want. This will be the value you pass in as a secret header from the
    Contentful Webhook settings to use **[On-Demand
    Revalidation](https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/next.js/incremental-static-regeneration#on-demand-revalidation){.link_link__hbWKh
    .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}**

Your `.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} file should look like this:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
CONTENTFUL_SPACE_ID=...
CONTENTFUL_ACCESS_TOKEN=...
CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_ACCESS_TOKEN=...
CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_SECRET=...
CONTENTFUL_REVALIDATE_SECRET=...
```

#### Step 6. Run Next.js in development mode {#step-6.-run-next.js-in-development-mode .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
npm install
npm run dev

# or

yarn install
yarn dev
```

Your blog should be up and running on
[http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}! If
it doesn\'t work, post on [GitHub
discussions](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/discussions){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

#### Step 7. Try Draft Mode {#step-7.-try-draft-mode .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

In your Contentful space, go to **Settings \> Content preview** and add
a new content preview for development.

The **Name** field may be anything, like
`Development`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}. Then, under **Content preview URLs**, check **Post**
and set its value to:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
http://localhost:3000/api/draft?secret=<CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_SECRET>&slug={entry.fields.slug}
```

Replace `<CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_SECRET>`{.inline_code__cgX1y
geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} with its respective value in
`.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}.

Once saved, go to one of the posts you\'ve created and:

- **Update the title**. For example, you can add
  `[Draft]`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
  in front of the title.
- The state of the post will switch to **CHANGED** automatically. **Do
  not** publish it. By doing this, the post will be in draft state.
- In the sidebar, you will see the **Open preview** button. Click on it!

You will now be able to see the updated title. To manually exit Draft
Mode, you can navigate to `/api/disable-draft`{.inline_code__cgX1y
geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} in the browser.

#### Step 8. Deploy on Vercel {#step-8.-deploy-on-vercel .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can deploy this app to the cloud with
[Vercel](https://vercel.com?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=next-example){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
([Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs/deployment){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}).

Deploy Your Local Project

To deploy your local project to Vercel, push it to
GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket and [import to
Vercel](https://vercel.com/new?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=next-example){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

**Important**: When you import your project on Vercel, make sure to
click on **Environment Variables** and set them to match your
`.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
file.

Deploy from Our Template

Alternatively, you can deploy using our template by clicking on the
Deploy button below.

This will deploy the Next.js project as well as connect it to your
Contentful space using the Vercel Contentful Integration. If you are
using Draft Mode, make sure to add
`CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_SECRET`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} as an [Environment
Variable](https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/projects/environment-variables){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} as
well.

[](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fvercel%2Fnext.js%2Ftree%2Fcanary%2Fexamples%2Fcms-contentful&project-name=nextjs-contentful-blog&repository-name=nextjs-contentful-blog&demo-title=Next.js+Blog&demo-description=Static+blog+with+multiple+authors+using+Draft+Mode&demo-url=https%3A%2F%2Fnext-blog-contentful.vercel.app%2F&demo-image=https%3A%2F%2Fassets.vercel.com%2Fimage%2Fupload%2Fv1625705016%2Ffront%2Fexamples%2FCleanShot_2021-07-07_at_19.43.15_2x.png&integration-ids=oac_aZtAZpDfT1lX3zrnWy7KT9VA&env=CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_SECRET,CONTENTFUL_REVALIDATE_SECRET&envDescription=Any%20URL%20friendly%20value%20to%20secure%20Your%20App){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

#### Step 9. Try using On-Demand Revalidation {#step-9.-try-using-on-demand-revalidation .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

In your Contentful space, go to **Settings \> Webhooks** and add a new
webhook:

- **Give the webhook a name**

- **Activate:** Check the activate checkbox to ensure the webhook is
  marked as active

- **Specify the POST URL:** Using the URL from your Vercel deployment in
  step 8, add the path `/api/revalidate`{.inline_code__cgX1y
  geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} at the end, so it would look
  something like:

  ``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
  https://<YOUR_VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL>/api/revalidate
  ```

  Replace `<YOUR_VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL>`{.inline_code__cgX1y
  geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} with your own deployment URL
  as noted in the Vercel dashboard.

- **Specify Triggers:** You can choose to trigger for all events or
  specific events only, such as the Publishing and Unpublishing of
  Entries and Assets, as shown below.

- **Specify Secret Header:** Add a secret header named
  `x-vercel-reval-key`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} and enter the value of the
  `CONTENTFUL_REVALIDATE_SECRET`{.inline_code__cgX1y
  geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} from before.

- **Set Content type:** Set content type to
  `application/json`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} in the dropdown.

- **Edit post:** Now, try editing the title of one of your blog posts in
  Contentful and click Publish. You should see the changed reflected in
  the website you just deployed, all without triggering a build! Behind
  the scenes a call was made to the revalidate api that triggers a
  revalidation of both the landing page and the specific post that was
  changed.

- **Verify:** You can verify if your request was made successfully by
  checking the webhook request log on Contentful and checking for a
  successful 200 status code, or by having your functions tab open on
  Vercel when committing the change (log drains may also be used). If
  you are experiencing issues with the api call, ensure you have
  correctly entered in the value for environment variable
  `CONTENTFUL_REVALIDATE_SECRET`{.inline_code__cgX1y
  geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} within your Vercel deployment.

## A statically generated blog example using Next.js and Contentful {#a-statically-generated-blog-example-using-next.js-and-contentful-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

This example showcases Next.js\'s [Static
Generation](https://nextjs.org/docs/basic-features/pages){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
feature using
[Contentful](https://www.contentful.com/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} as
the data source.

### How to use {#how-to-use-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

Execute [`create-next-app`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/packages/create-next-app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} with
[npm](https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/init){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"},
[Yarn](https://yarnpkg.com/lang/en/docs/cli/create/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}, or
[pnpm](https://pnpm.io){.link_link__hbWKh .link_highlight__kJZF9
rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} to bootstrap the example:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
npx create-next-app --example cms-contentful cms-contentful-app
```

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
yarn create next-app --example cms-contentful cms-contentful-app
```

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm create next-app --example cms-contentful cms-contentful-app
```

### Configuration {#configuration-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

#### Step 1. Create an account and a space on Contentful {#step-1.-create-an-account-and-a-space-on-contentful-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

First, [create an account on
Contentful](https://www.contentful.com/sign-up/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

After creating an account, create a new empty **space** from the
[dashboard](https://app.contentful.com/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} and
assign to it any name of your liking.

#### Step 2. Create a content model {#step-2.-create-a-content-model-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

The [content
model](https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/concepts/data-model/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
defines the data structures of your application/websites. The structures
are flexible and you can tailor them to your needs.

For this example you need to create a content model that defines an
author and a post content type. **You can create these two by running a
script or by doing it manually** to familiarize yourself with the
Contentful user interface.

Run a script to create the content model

This project includes a setup script which you can use to set up the
content model expected by the source code.

In your Contentful dashboard go to **Settings \> General Settings** and
copy the **Space ID**.

Next, go to **Settings \> CMA tokens** and create a new token by
clicking **Create personal access token**. This token has the same
access rights as the logged in user. **Do not share it publicly**, you
will only use it to set up your space and can delete it afterwards.

With the space ID and management access token at hand run the following
command:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
npx cross-env CONTENTFUL_SPACE_ID=YOUR_SPACE_ID CONTENTFUL_MANAGEMENT_TOKEN=XXX npm run setup
```

This command will create the needed content structures and set up your
Contentful space ready to use. The output should look as follows:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
> cms-contentful@1.0.0 setup /Users/stefan.judis/Projects/next.js/examples/cms-contentful
> node ./contentful/setup.js $CONTENTFUL_SPACE_ID $CONTENTFUL_MANAGEMENT_TOKEN
```

Create the content model manually Create an `Author`{.inline_code__cgX1y
geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} content type

From your contentful space, go to **Content model** and add a new
content type:

- Give it the **Name** `Author`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"}, the **Api Identifier** should be
  `author`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}

Once the content model is saved, add these fields (you don\'t have to
modify the settings unless specified):

- `name`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} -
  **Text** field (type **short text**). **Field ID** should be set to
  `name`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
- `picture`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} - **Media** field (type **one file**). **Field ID**
  should be set to `picture`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"}

Save the content type and continue.

Create a `post`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} type

From your contentful space, go to **Content model** and add another
content type:

- Give it the **Name** `Post`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"}, the **Api Identifier** should be
  `post`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}

Next, add these fields (you don\'t have to modify the settings unless
specified):

- `title`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} -
  **Text** field (type **short text**)
- `content`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} - **Rich text** field
- `excerpt`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} - **Text** field (type **Long text, full-text
  search**)
- `coverImage`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} - **Media** field (type **one file**)
- `date`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} -
  **Date and time** field
- `slug`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} -
  **Text** field. You can optionally go to the settings of this field,
  and under **Appearance**, select **Slug** to display it as a slug of
  the `title`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} field.
- `author`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} -
  **Reference** field (type **one reference**)

Save the content type and continue.

#### Step 3. Validate your content model {#step-3.-validate-your-content-model-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

After setting up the content model (either manually or by running
`npm run setup`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} or `yarn setup`{.inline_code__cgX1y
geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}), it should look as follows.

**Content model overview**

#### Step 4. Populate Content {#step-4.-populate-content-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Go to the **Content** section in your space, then click on **Add entry**
and select the **Author** content type:

- You just need **1 author entry**.
- Use dummy data for the text.
- For the image, you can download one from
  [Unsplash](https://unsplash.com/){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

Next, create another entry with the content type **Post**:

- We recommend creating at least **2 post entries**.
- Use dummy data for the text.
- For images, you can download them from
  [Unsplash](https://unsplash.com/){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.
- Pick the **author** you created earlier.

**Important:** For each entry and asset, you need to click on
**Publish**. If not, the entry will be in draft state.

#### Step 5. Set up environment variables {#step-5.-set-up-environment-variables-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

From your contentful space, go to **Settings \> API keys**. There will
be an example Content delivery / preview token - you can use these API
keys. (You may also create a new key.)

Next, copy the `.env.local.example`{.inline_code__cgX1y
geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} file in this directory to
`.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
(which will be ignored by Git):

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
cp .env.local.example .env.local
```

Then set each variable on `.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y
geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}:

- `CONTENTFUL_SPACE_ID`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} should be the **Space ID** field of your API Key
- `CONTENTFUL_ACCESS_TOKEN`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} should be the **[Content Delivery
  API](https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/references/content-delivery-api/){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} -
  access token** field of your API key
- `CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_ACCESS_TOKEN`{.inline_code__cgX1y
  geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} should be the **[Content
  Preview
  API](https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/references/content-preview-api/){.link_link__hbWKh
  .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} -
  access token** field of your API key
- `CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_SECRET`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} should be any value you want. It must be URL
  friendly as the dashboard will send it as a query parameter to enable
  Next.js Draft Mode
- - `CONTENTFUL_REVALIDATE_SECRET`{.inline_code__cgX1y
    geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} should be any value you
    want. This will be the value you pass in as a secret header from the
    Contentful Webhook settings to use **[On-Demand
    Revalidation](https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/next.js/incremental-static-regeneration#on-demand-revalidation){.link_link__hbWKh
    .link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}**

Your `.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} file should look like this:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
CONTENTFUL_SPACE_ID=...
CONTENTFUL_ACCESS_TOKEN=...
CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_ACCESS_TOKEN=...
CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_SECRET=...
CONTENTFUL_REVALIDATE_SECRET=...
```

#### Step 6. Run Next.js in development mode {#step-6.-run-next.js-in-development-mode-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
npm install
npm run dev

# or

yarn install
yarn dev
```

Your blog should be up and running on
[http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}! If
it doesn\'t work, post on [GitHub
discussions](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/discussions){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

#### Step 7. Try Draft Mode {#step-7.-try-draft-mode-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

In your Contentful space, go to **Settings \> Content preview** and add
a new content preview for development.

The **Name** field may be anything, like
`Development`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}. Then, under **Content preview URLs**, check **Post**
and set its value to:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
http://localhost:3000/api/draft?secret=<CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_SECRET>&slug={entry.fields.slug}
```

Replace `<CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_SECRET>`{.inline_code__cgX1y
geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} with its respective value in
`.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}.

Once saved, go to one of the posts you\'ve created and:

- **Update the title**. For example, you can add
  `[Draft]`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
  in front of the title.
- The state of the post will switch to **CHANGED** automatically. **Do
  not** publish it. By doing this, the post will be in draft state.
- In the sidebar, you will see the **Open preview** button. Click on it!

You will now be able to see the updated title. To manually exit Draft
Mode, you can navigate to `/api/disable-draft`{.inline_code__cgX1y
geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} in the browser.

#### Step 8. Deploy on Vercel {#step-8.-deploy-on-vercel-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can deploy this app to the cloud with
[Vercel](https://vercel.com?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=next-example){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
([Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs/deployment){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}).

Deploy Your Local Project

To deploy your local project to Vercel, push it to
GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket and [import to
Vercel](https://vercel.com/new?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=next-example){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

**Important**: When you import your project on Vercel, make sure to
click on **Environment Variables** and set them to match your
`.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
file.

Deploy from Our Template

Alternatively, you can deploy using our template by clicking on the
Deploy button below.

This will deploy the Next.js project as well as connect it to your
Contentful space using the Vercel Contentful Integration. If you are
using Draft Mode, make sure to add
`CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_SECRET`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} as an [Environment
Variable](https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/projects/environment-variables){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} as
well.

[](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fvercel%2Fnext.js%2Ftree%2Fcanary%2Fexamples%2Fcms-contentful&project-name=nextjs-contentful-blog&repository-name=nextjs-contentful-blog&demo-title=Next.js+Blog&demo-description=Static+blog+with+multiple+authors+using+Draft+Mode&demo-url=https%3A%2F%2Fnext-blog-contentful.vercel.app%2F&demo-image=https%3A%2F%2Fassets.vercel.com%2Fimage%2Fupload%2Fv1625705016%2Ffront%2Fexamples%2FCleanShot_2021-07-07_at_19.43.15_2x.png&integration-ids=oac_aZtAZpDfT1lX3zrnWy7KT9VA&env=CONTENTFUL_PREVIEW_SECRET,CONTENTFUL_REVALIDATE_SECRET&envDescription=Any%20URL%20friendly%20value%20to%20secure%20Your%20App){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

#### Step 9. Try using On-Demand Revalidation {#step-9.-try-using-on-demand-revalidation-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

In your Contentful space, go to **Settings \> Webhooks** and add a new
webhook:

- **Give the webhook a name**

- **Activate:** Check the activate checkbox to ensure the webhook is
  marked as active

- **Specify the POST URL:** Using the URL from your Vercel deployment in
  step 8, add the path `/api/revalidate`{.inline_code__cgX1y
  geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} at the end, so it would look
  something like:

  ``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
  https://<YOUR_VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL>/api/revalidate
  ```

  Replace `<YOUR_VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL>`{.inline_code__cgX1y
  geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} with your own deployment URL
  as noted in the Vercel dashboard.

- **Specify Triggers:** You can choose to trigger for all events or
  specific events only, such as the Publishing and Unpublishing of
  Entries and Assets, as shown below.

- **Specify Secret Header:** Add a secret header named
  `x-vercel-reval-key`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} and enter the value of the
  `CONTENTFUL_REVALIDATE_SECRET`{.inline_code__cgX1y
  geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} from before.

- **Set Content type:** Set content type to
  `application/json`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
  data-version="v1"} in the dropdown.

- **Edit post:** Now, try editing the title of one of your blog posts in
  Contentful and click Publish. You should see the changed reflected in
  the website you just deployed, all without triggering a build! Behind
  the scenes a call was made to the revalidate api that triggers a
  revalidation of both the landing page and the specific post that was
  changed.

- **Verify:** You can verify if your request was made successfully by
  checking the webhook request log on Contentful and checking for a
  successful 200 status code, or by having your functions tab open on
  Vercel when committing the change (log drains may also be used). If
  you are experiencing issues with the api call, ensure you have
  correctly entered in the value for environment variable
  `CONTENTFUL_REVALIDATE_SECRET`{.inline_code__cgX1y
  geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} within your Vercel deployment.
:::

## Next.js: SSG + Preview Mode Demo {#next.js-ssg-preview-mode-demo .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

This demo showcases Next.js\' next-gen Static Site Generation (SSG)
support.

### About {#about .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

Next.js is the first hybrid framework, allowing you to choose the
technique that fits your use case best on a per-page basis: [Static
Generation or On-Demand
rendering](https://nextjs.org/docs/basic-features/data-fetching){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

This application solely focuses on Static Generation (using
`getStaticProps`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}), however, with a game-changing new feature: Preview
Mode.

[Take Preview Mode for a
spin](https://next-preview.vercel.app/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}!

Preview Mode leverages Next.js\' on-demand rendering capabilities to
bypass the statically prerendered page and render the page on-demand for
**authorized users**.

This feature is incredibly valuable for content editors who want to view
real-time draft content from their CMS, among other use cases.

### Learn More {#learn-more .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can learn more about this feature in the [Next.js 9.3 Blog
Post](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-9-3){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} or
our
[Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs/advanced-features/preview-mode){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.
:::
